Articles.Content: Is there any special key binding like Ctrl+C? and Ctrl+V?
I do believe that it is simply Alt + Click on any part to duplicate it.
If you alt-click a parent object, all the children attached will be cloned, as well. Very handy, and the more you use it, the more you'll like it.
Alt-click a part, all parts attached to it will be copied

For parts which you might want to use in your later designs, use the Subassembly storage. It is the rightmost of the black tabs in the upper left. Tear or copy a part off your design and drop it onto the Subassembly drop zone. Then give it a name and a description and you can load it anytime again.

Alt+Click = Duplication. Handy to use, If you want a part or a segmate of a ship to use later or long-term, Refer to the sentence under this one.

Subassembly tab = Far Right of the part selector. Drag the part(s) (one at a time) Give it a name, Description and it will remain there. If im correct it'll only not be there if you're playing on a new save other than the one that had the subassembly.

This should actually be changed from [unanswered] to [Answered!].
